feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From The Bering Strait to Point Hope Through Monday... Northwest winds of 15 to 30 mph are expected to develop tonight over the southern Chukchi Sea continue into Monday. This will cause elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:18AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Surf From Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow Through Monday Night... Southwest winds of 20 to 30 mph blowing over the Arctic Coast from Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow are causing elevated surf. These winds will continue into Monday, then turn northwest Monday afternoon, and decrease Monday night. These winds are causing
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:31PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino and Yavapai Counties just east of Ash Fork through 700 PM MST... At 630 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm just east of Ash Fork, or 28 miles north of Chino Valley, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 6:02PM MST until August 12 at 11:15PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA AND EAST CENTRAL LA PAZ COUNTIES... At 602 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Jackrabbit Wash. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen.
